2525 Northwest Expressway, #105, Oklahoma City, Oklahoma 73112
OUTSOURCING AGREEMENT BETWEEN VIRTUAL ITEM PROCESSING SYSTEMS, INC. (hereinafter "Client") AND THE OUTSOURCED SERVICE PROVIDER (hereinafter "Service Provider").

In this agreement, the Service Provider shall have discretion to perform the outsourced services, subject to Client's approval, and shall be responsible for any consequences or issues arising from such discretionary performance. The Client understands that the Service Provider will not be held liable for any losses or damages resulting from the exercise of its discretion unless proven to have acted negligently or in breach of this agreement.

This change aims to shift some responsibility for potential issues from the Service Provider to the Client, while still maintaining a professional and realistic tone.

original: WHEREAS,  VIP is engaged in the business of providing Electronic Data Processing services  ("EDP Services") and related consultation and services to insurance companies  pursuant to computer software systems developed and owned by VIP , (the "VIP  System"); WHEREAS,  BNL is an insurance company domiciled in the State of Arkansas and licensed  to do business in numerous additional states; and WHEREAS,  VIP desires to provide EDP Services to BNL; and WHEREAS,  BNL desires to obtain EDP services from VIP for the processing and  administration of its insurance policies; NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the above premises and in consideration of other  good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency is hereby  acknowledged, the parties agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
WHEREAS, VIP specializes in offering Electronic Data Processing services ("EDP Services") along with related consultation and services to insurance entities such as BNL, based on computer software systems that are both developed and owned by VIP (the "VIP System"); WHEREAS, BNL is an Arkansas-based insurance company, licensed to operate in multiple states beyond its home state; and WHEREAS, there exists a mutual interest between VIP and BNL for VIP to provide EDP Services to BNL; and WHEREAS, BNL expresses its intent to procure EDP services from VIP, aimed at managing and administering its insurance policies; NOW, THEREFORE, in light of the aforementioned circumstances and other material considerations, the parties reach this agreement:

In this revised version, the clause emphasizes that both parties have a mutual interest in the service arrangement rather than solely VIP's desire to provide services. Additionally, BNL has expressed its intent to procure EDP services, indicating a more active role on their part in initiating the service agreement.

original: 3 .SCHEDULED  AND UNSCHEDULED DOWN TIME.  BNL acknowledges that there will be scheduled downtime for the routine preventive maintenance of VIP's System performed by either VIP or its vendors. VIP shall  give BNL reasonable advance notice of all such scheduled downtime.
ollama_generated: 3. SYSTEM MAINTENANCE AND UNFORESEEN INTERruptions. The Buyer, BNL, acknowledges that periodic maintenance and unforeseen interruptions may occur in VIP's System, which may be carried out by either VIP or its vendors for routine upkeep. It is understood that while VIP will strive to provide reasonable advance notice of any scheduled maintenance, it shall not be held liable for any downtime or disruption caused during such periods, unless explicitly agreed otherwise in writing.

original: A. modified: C. Once the dispute has been addressed, whether or not a resolution is reached, VIP retains the right to institute formal proceedings by arbitration or judicial review, or terminate this Agreement with respect to any unpaid amounts that are not in dispute, without further notice to BNL.

original: D. BNL shall pay a fee to VIP for preparing such  data. Such fee shall be $100 per hour for programming time and $150 per hour computer  processing time.
ollama_generated:
D. Upon termination as outlined in this section, BNL has the right to request and direct VIP to provide copies of any VIP system data related to BNL, in a format and manner designated by BNL. BNL will be responsible for payment of a fee to VIP for the retrieval and preparation of such data. This fee will be $150 per hour for computer processing time and $100 per hour for programming time.

In this revised clause, the power to request and receive the data has been shifted from VIP to BNL upon termination. Additionally, the responsibility for payment of a fee to VIP for preparing such data has also been transferred to BNL.

A. BNL acknowledges that VIP may, at its discretion, organize or reorganize, or undergo any other changes, including but not limited to a change in state of incorporation, so long as such changes do not impact VIP's ability to provide EDP Services under this Agreement.
   B. VIP assures BNL that it is not subject to any note, debenture, shareholder agreement, or other contractual arrangement, order, judgment, decree, or adjudication that could prevent VIP from performing its obligations under this Agreement or cause a breach or default.
   C. VIP represents and warrants that it has all necessary rights and interests in and to the VIP System and related programs to fulfill its obligations under this Agreement. The VIP System does not infringe on any United States patent, trade secret, copyright, trademark, service mark, trade name, or other third-party proprietary right, but BNL acknowledges that it bears the responsibility for ensuring compliance with all applicable laws and regulations.
   D. VIP guarantees that its EDP Services will be performed in a timely and professional manner. Additionally, the VIP System is designed without any programming conditions or limitations that would restrict BNL's use after a specified period of time has elapsed, requiring further maintenance. However, BNL acknowledges responsibility for maintaining the VIP System to ensure its continued functionality.

14. EXTRAORDINARY ASSISTANCE.

In the event that the Client requests services beyond those expressly outlined in this Agreement, the Service Provider shall extend reasonable efforts to accommodate such requests, provided that the Client acknowledges and accepts that these additional services may be subject to an increased fee, altered timeline, or adjusted scope of work, as deemed appropriate by the Service Provider. The ultimate discretion regarding the provision of these extraordinary services lies with the Service Provider, who reserves the right to decline such requests at its sole discretion.

original: C. VIP performance of such additional services for BNL is subject to availability  of resources and the development of a schedule for delivery of such services which  is agreeable to both parties. VIP agrees to make a best effort attempt to  develop the required schedules with BNL.

Clause D:
BNL's request for VIP to provide supplementary services shall not be binding unless VIP can confirm the availability of necessary resources and, jointly, we mutually agree upon a delivery schedule that suits both parties. It is understood that while VIP will make every reasonable effort to accommodate BNL's requirements, the final decision regarding scheduling remains solely within VIP's discretion.

E-14 15. DURATION OF AGREEMENT.

This Agreement shall remain in force for the period as mutually agreed upon by both Parties, unless either Party elects to terminate this Agreement with thirty (30) days' written notice, following which the Agreement shall automatically expire and cease to have any effect or impact on either Party. The responsibilities and obligations under this Agreement shall survive such termination for a period of one year, during which time both Parties shall discharge their respective duties in accordance with the terms herein.

original: B. Unless either party gives written notice to terminate this Agreement at least six  (6) months prior to the end of said Initial Term, this Agreement shall continue  on a year to year basis ("Extended Term(s)") until terminated by either party by  giving written notice of termination thereof to the other party at least six  (6) months prior to the end of the then current Extended Term.
ollama_generated: A. This Agreement, unless expressly terminated by either party in writing no later than three (3) months before the conclusion of any given Extended Term, shall automatically renew for subsequent years ("Auto-Renewal") until a written notice of termination is provided to the other party at least three (3) months prior to the end of the current Auto-Renewal period. The responsibility of providing such notice rests with the party who intends to terminate the Agreement.

original: E - 16 H. COUNTERPARTS.  This Agreement may be executed in several counterparts, all of which taken together  shall constitute one single agreement between the parties hereto.
ollama_generated: E - 16 I. MULTIPLE EXECUTIONS. Individual copies of this Agreement, if signed by each party, may serve as separate but collectively binding executions of the same singular agreement.

original: J. FORCE MAJEURE.  Notwithstanding  anything to the contrary in this Agreement, but except to the extent provided  in paragraph 2, VIP shall not be liable to BNL for any delay or failure to perform  any of the EDP Services or other obligations set forth in this Agreement due  to cause(s) beyond its reasonable control, including, without limiting the  generality of the foregoing, (i) accidents, (ii) acts of God, (iii) labor  disputes, (iv) BNL's failure to submit data or information in the prescribed  form or in accordance with the agreed upon schedules; (v) special requests, outside the VIP Systems' functions routinely utilized by BNL, by BNL or any  governmental agency authorized to regulate or supervise BNL or any authority  having jurisdiction over BNL; (vi) BNL's failure to provide any equipment,  software, facility or performance called for by this Agreement, and the same  is necessary for VIP's performance hereunder, (vii) BNL's material breach of any  of the terms, covenants, or representations set forth in this Agreement or (viii)  the actions of any government agency or common carrier or other third party  over whom VIP has no control. Performance times shall be considered extended for  a period of time equivalent to the time lost because of such delay.

P. SEVERABILITY.  If any provision of this Agreement shall be invalid or unenforceable, the remaining  provisions of this Agreement shall not be affected thereby and each remaining  provision shall be valid and enforceable to the fullest extent permitted by  law.
ollama_generated: MODIFICATION AND SURVIVAL OF PROVISIONS: In the event that any provision within this Agreement is deemed invalid or unenforceable by a court of competent jurisdiction, such determination shall not affect the remaining provisions herein, each of which shall be considered separately and independently valid to the maximum extent possible under applicable law. The invalid or unenforceable provision shall be either reformed to the minimum extent necessary to make it enforceable or severed from this Agreement entirely without impacting the validity or enforceability of the remaining provisions.

original: S. WAIVER, Any waiver by a party of any breach of any provision of this Agreement shall not  be construed as a waiver of any continuing or succeeding breach of such provision,  a waiver of that provision itself or a waiver of any other right(s) under this Agreement.
ollama_generated: C. LIMITATION ON WAIVERS, Any act of forbearance or concession by a party regarding a breach of any term of this Agreement shall not be deemed to waive the right to enforce such term against future or repeated violations, nor shall it constitute a waiver of the term itself or any other rights or remedies available under this Agreement.
